sect2.title: Installation of OpenJade
sect2.para: First fix problems when building with newer compilers:
Now fix a compilation problem with perl-5.16 and later:
Install OpenJade by running the following commands:
This package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput:
make install && make install-man && ln -v -sf openjade /usr/bin/jade && ln -v -sf libogrove.so /usr/lib/libgrove.so && ln -v -sf libospgrove.so /usr/lib/libspgrove.so && ln -v -sf libostyle.so /usr/lib/libstyle.so &&
install -v -m644 dsssl/catalog /usr/share/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version;/ &&
install -v -m644 dsssl/*.{dtd,dsl,sgm} \ /usr/share/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version; &&
install-catalog --add /etc/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version;.cat \ /usr/share/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version;/catalog &&
install-catalog --add /etc/sgml/sgml-docbook.cat \ /etc/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version;.cat

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: export CXXFLAGS=...: This command prevents segmentation faults when the package is compiled with gcc-6.1.
make install-man: This command installs the openjade man page.
--disable-static: This switch prevents the building of the static library.
--enable-http: This switch adds support for HTTP.
--enable-default-catalog=/etc/sgml/catalog: This switch sets the path to the centralized catalog.
--enable-default-search-path: This switch sets the default value of SGML_SEARCH_PATH.
--datadir=/usr/share/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version;: This switch puts data files in /usr/share/sgml/openjade-&openjade-version; instead of /usr/share.
ln -v -sf ...: These commands create the Jade equivalents of OpenJade executables and libraries.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: This configuration is only necessary if you intend to use OpenJade to process the BLFS XML files through DSSSL Stylesheets.
